intro: Melandrium echegarayi, commonly known as the Echegaray's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or open habitats. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers with four petals, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it has a fibrous root system. Melandrium echegarayi is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other members like the common carnation.
